content.description: Start as for Shortness of Breath. As soon as you clear the roof, traverse right with gymnastic moves following an undercut horizontal fingercrack/seam all the way around right to top out just left of where Meadows Roof tops out. Safer and more sustained than the original.
Sit start on good holds at the bottom of the face just left of the roof. Move up through more good holds and turn a small roof. From here go left on blocky holds then up easier terrain.
content.protection: Several pads and spotters. There is a large but flat topped boulder that you might land on, or you might just pinball down in between the two boulders.

content.description: Starts with a fingerlock in a crack in the big hueco under the roof. Move out left onto fair crimps, find some foot trickery to allow you to move up to any of several decent holds just below the lip, then find your way up and over.
content.protection: Several pads necessary to protect the blocky landing.
content.location: The most obvious line up the obvious roof.

content.description: The small Boulder below shortness of breath. Pull on with a low sloping right hand crimp and compress the left . Heel hook and slap your way to the top. Not sure if it's been done before . Good movement on a small rock.
content.location: The Overhanging face of the Boulder below/behind shortness of breath

content.description: Stand start with the high left hand sidepull/pinch and right hand sloper arete and compress your way up the boulder.
